noun.description: A metre consisting of a dactyl followed by a spondee; a verse or line written in this metre.

adjective.description: Of a verse or line: written in a metre consisting of a dactyl followed by a spondee.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in Gabriel Harvey (c1552–1631), scholar and writer. From post-classical Latin Adonicus from classical Latin Adōnis, the name of Adonis + -icus, after e.g. classical Latin Sapphicus Sapphic; apparently so called as originally used in lamentations for Adonis; compare Sappho Fragment 168 ὦ τὸν Ἄδωνιν O Adonis, an example of this metre.
